details:
#### Primary Objective:
Retrieve all information related to hospital operations, financial performance, staff management, regulatory compliance, and strategic planning to ensure efficient and effective hospital management.

#### Core Information to Retrieve:
-   **Financial Reports:** Budget variance reports, revenue cycle summaries, income statements, operating margins, departmental P&L (Profit and Loss).
-   **Operational Metrics:** Bed occupancy rates, average length of stay (ALOS), patient wait times, emergency department throughput, readmission rates, surgical case volumes.
-   **Staffing & HR:** Nurse-to-patient ratios, staffing schedules, overtime reports, physician credentialing status, employee turnover rates, staff satisfaction surveys.
-   **Quality & Safety:** Patient safety incident reports, infection control rates, HCAHPS scores (patient satisfaction), mortality rates, quality improvement project summaries.
-   **Regulatory & Compliance:** Joint Commission survey results, HIPAA compliance audits, CMS (Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services) reports, OSHA safety reports, risk management assessments.
-   **Contracts & Procurement:** Vendor agreements, Group Purchasing Organization (GPO) contracts, medical supply costs, capital equipment purchase orders.
-   **Strategic Documents:** Board of Directors meeting minutes, strategic plans, market share analysis, service line development proposals, community health needs assessments.

#### Information to Ignore (Noise):
-   Individual patient medical records (PHI) and detailed clinical case notes.
-   Specific, detailed surgical procedure instructions or techniques.
-   In-depth academic medical research papers or clinical trial data.
-   Low-level departmental communications (e.g., daily shift change emails).
-   Cafeteria menus or gift shop inventory lists.
-   Individual employee performance reviews or payroll details.
